meanings.definition: A mixture of snow and dirt.
meanings.sent1: The children played in the snirt, making snowballs mixed with dirt.
meanings.sent2: After the blizzard, the driveway was covered in snirt.
meanings.sent3: The snirt on the ground looked like a tasty chocolate-vanilla swirl ice cream cone.
meanings.sent4: The snirt on the road resembled a zebra's stripes, with alternating patches of white and brown.
meanings.sent5: The snirt created a messy, slushy mess that was hard to walk through.

meanings.sent1: I accidentally snirted my shoes while walking through the slushy snow.
meanings.sent2: The dog loves to snirt around in the fresh snow, leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent3: My little brother always manages to snirt up his clothes within minutes of playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The car windshield quickly snirted over as we drove through the snowstorm.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to snirt your clean clothes when you go outside in the snow.

meanings.sent1: The snirt at the edge of the parking lot was a mix of snow and mud.
meanings.sent2: The plow pushed the snirt to the side of the road, creating a messy pile.
meanings.sent3: The kids built a fort out of snirt, pretending it was a castle made of snow and dirt.
meanings.sent4: The snirt near the sidewalk had tire tracks running through it, making it look like a muddy river.
meanings.sent5: The snirt piled up against the fence, forming a barrier of dirty snow.
